articles.headline: 2025 AAC college football projections, preview
articles.description: Bill Connelly previews the AAC, which could have some more surprise surges in store for 2025.

images.name: Blake Horvath makes Navy history with a 95-yard TD
images.caption: Blake Horvath keeps the ball and goes for a 95-yard rushing touchdown, the longest run in Navy history, to tie the score 14-14.

articles.headline: 2026 NFL draft: Ranking top five prospects at every position
articles.description: Matt Miller and Jordan Reid stack their early top-fives at every position and break down the players they'll be watching during the 2025 season.

articles.headline: Oregon lands No. 1 safety Washington, nephew of Kobe Bryant
articles.description: Four-star prospect Jett Washington, ESPN's No. 1 safety in the 2026 class, announced his commitment to Oregon over Alabama and USC.

articles.headline: Brandon Arrington, No. 1 athlete prospect in 2026, picks Texas A&M
articles.description: Brandon Arrington, the No. 1 athlete prospect and 14th overall recruit in the 2026 ESPN 300, has committed to Texas A&M.

articles.headline: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
articles.description: There are 21 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

article.headline: Experienced Charlotte downs Fordham 34-10
article.description: Benny LeMay ran for 135 yards and two scores, Juwan Foggie had a pick-6 and Charlotte beat Fordham 34-10 in Saturday's season opener whose start was delayed more than an hour by lightning which later forced fans to evacuate at halftime.
article.story: CHARLOTTE, N.C. -- Benny LeMay ran for 135 yards and two scores, Juwan Foggie had a pick-6 and Charlotte beat Fordham 34-10 in Saturday's season opener whose start was delayed more than an hour by lightning which later forced fans to evacuate at halftime. With 17 returning starters, including its top four tacklers, Charlotte dominated in the teams' first gridiron meeting, holding the Rams to 13 first-half rushing yards while building a 13-7 lead behind LeMay's 2-yard run and Jonathan Cruz's two field goals. LeMay (25 carries) scored again on a 4-yard run when play resumed after lightning forced fans to shelter in nearby academic buildings. Chris Reynolds (13 of 20 for 267 yards) hit Victor Tucker on a 12-yard TD pass in the fourth quarter and linebacker Foggie intercepted Luke Medlock's pass and returned it 26 yards for a score. Medlock was 22 of 47 for 296 yards passing, hitting Austin Longi for a 70-yard first-quarter TD. Longi had eight catches for 113 yards for the Rams, who returned eight starters in coach Joe Conlin's debut.
